intro: Brachyotum intermedium, commonly known as the intermediate brachyotum, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. Brachyotum intermedium produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring and are followed by fluffy, seed-bearing structures.
